fields.description:
Trying to rename a page using the storePage method fails with the following exception :

Server: You can't change an existing page's title or space. 

However i  can rename the page using the web interface.
fields.summary: Store Page fails when page is renamed.

fields.description:
After having just accidentally closed the window after typing for 2 hours, autosave is a feature I would love to see in a future release.

Yes, people can hit Add/Update but then their further edits are marked as revisions to that.  If I clicked before I was done, subscribers would have received my page in an incomplete state.

Autosave could be implemented with a Javascript timer that posts the current text box to a scrap area that each user has.  It could be a user preference as to when that scrap area is purged.  But if my text box had posted to that area, I could just go there and paste that back into the page I prematurely closed.
fields.summary: Autosave of editing box

fields.description:
If I'm using external management I do expect an email to be sent out to the user with the password in Jira (I don't want any password being via email anyways).  I've added twenty-five odd users and all got an email with an invalid password.

Causes too much headache.
fields.summary: Illogical Email sent out after registering user

fields.description:
I cannot update a page over a certain size.  If I look at the exception that is generated it says: Stream type cannot be used in batching.  

This is on a production version of Confluence (rc6...I know, I need to upgrade to 1.0) but I need some assurance that this will be fixed quickly.

Thanks,
Noah
fields.summary: Stream type cannot be used in batching

fields.description:
I am unable to export anything to PDF due to X windows not being installed on the server, this is a common configuration on most hosted servers. 

The following error presents itself in the server log:

INFO: Invoking rollback for transaction on method 'exportAs' in class [com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportManager] due to throwable [java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /opt/j2sdk1.4.2_02/jre/lib/i386/libawt.so: libXp.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory]

I am unfamiliar with how the PDF export is generated, but is there a way to eliminate the use of awt? This would most likely fix it.
fields.summary: Unable to export to PDF on Linux server VM

fields.description:
One of our pages ended up ahead of the actual data source. Only knew of this, when someone left a "you suck" message as a comment.

Wonder if a hot referrers page for a space could be done,
or just static stats page on a nightly/weekly basis.

Or just a google/search engine stats listing.
fields.summary: Hot referrers for External Links summary for space/entire instance

fields.description:
That ability to extend / create custom macro's would be invaliuble - kinda like a plugin / extension system.

It could either be through loading a JAR file of classes extending a common interface or base class, or through bsh/scrappy code, or perhaps some other scripting language. I prefer the idea of dumping JAR files into a "macros" directory inside confluence (or an external lib directory being set to from confluence administration) as then it would allow the macro writer to do pretty much anything.

The possibilities are endless. We could integrate our confluence install with our custom intranet scripts (parsing the output and giving a more accurate output). We could get it so that it could parse the xml files our applications provide for documentation so that the documentation could seamlessly be integrated into confluence. We could get our IT support space to probe / parse the bind config files and list the current IP assignments. We could display the NOCOL information for our network system / uptime so dumb users can still obtain useful information without getting confused.

This is possible to a limited extent through include files - but macros would be so much better and avoid the need of portal scripts running on webservers.
fields.summary: Custom Defined Macro's
Make {jiraissues} macro's output column sortable

fields.description: We would most likely buy Confluence if there was an easy way to import from OpenWiki. Import should cover atleast current versions of pages and all attachments and links.
fields.summary: OpenWiki import

fields.description:
One of the features which I love from UNIX is the ability to "SU" to another user, and (optionally) take on their environment / shell / settings etc.

This would be very useful for confluence (and JIRA!) when managing permissions so that you can setup the groupings and permissions, then see what a user sees / has access to. This is especially useful when the groupings and permission structures arent simple.

Currently to do this you have to login with their password, in many cases we dont know their password and makes it hard to do without changing it.

There may also be reasons for being able to write content as another user, or be able to edit their profile.
fields.summary: User SU'ing

fields.description:
If a page contains several subsequent ampersands they aren't escaped using HTML entities in the rendered HTML.  For instance:

  a && b

is also in HTML rendered as:

  a && b

whereas:

  a & b

would be rendered as:

  a & b

The browser (at least IE/6.0) can deal with this, but the page can't be exported as a PDF:

Profile Templating

fields.description:
All other pages show what links to it, either using trackbacks or what have you under the title "Incoming Links" and allow you to "(more)" for a hierarchy of links. When you goto a profile page [~user] you dont get that.

As we are using it as a documentation platform and a company policy resource, we link alot to personnel. If a person was to leave the company or change job roles it would be useful to be able to goto the profile and see what links there are to this person directly. We could then easily update the pages.

Im sure there are other uses to having link tracking on a user - eg: if they were to be mentioned as an author or given credit a user could find out where his name is mentioned.
fields.summary: Add Link Tracking / Trackbacks to/from user profile page

fields.description:
Some page names can get rather long, especially with them having to be unique. It would be cool if a Tiny URL could be generated for each page that wants one ... something like: http://app.server.com/confluence/xGizYS which points to http://app.server.com/confluence/display/ITSUP/I+want+to+attached+a+60mb+attachment+to+my+email+...+is+that+a+problem%3F

The first URL would be much easier to paste into an email, or type out. Ideally the TinyURL would have no special characters and be in Base64 (case sensative A-Z a-z 0-9 form) to make it easier to remember.
fields.summary: Tiny URL support for Pages

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/dv+child+name+with+space

Creating a child page with a space at the end of the names causes failure in the linking.

Personally, removing white space from page names at creation time would be the best solution.
fields.summary: page names ending is space are not properly linked

fields.description:
Currently you can only create text links using [Link Title|LinkURL], it would be useful if you could use a picture [!myPic.gif!|LinkURL].

This would be useful being able to do a "click image for full size" in a tutorial which has screen shots. Automated thumbnailing would be cool, but usually Id like to be able to provide a myPic_Small.gif and a myPic_Big.gif as the small wont just be scalled down, it'll be croped as well.

fields.description:
Currently spaces are listed in a flat list. It would be useful if they could be grouped together in one (or more) ways. Take the following spaces for example:

Bob's Personal Area
Dan's Personal Area
Product A Documentation
Product A Development
Product A Support
Product B Documentation
Product B Development
Product B Support

Although they are spaces in their own right, it would be nice to have the following grouping possibilities (containing):

Personal Area's (Bob && Dan)
Product A (Doc && Dev && Support)
Product B (Doc && Dev && Support)
Documentation (Product A && Product B)
Development (Product A && Product B)
Support (Product A && Product B)

So a space could be in more than one group, and groups could be hierarchically nested. A group view of the dashboard would be where you see them.

Just a thought ...
fields.summary: Space Groups

fields.description:
Currently access permissions (view, comment, edit) are set space wide. It would be incredibly if exceptions could be made to the rule (either extending, or restricting the space permissions).

For example, if I have a personal space that I want everyone to see, I might make some blog posts, or a todo list in a page that I dont want to be public. [or visa versa, most posts private but a few public]

Or if I people normally cant comment on my pages, I might create a post which I do want people to comment on (and thus enable commenting just for that page).

The export to PDF fails with the following error: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: org.apache.fop.apps.FOPException: stream:41:0 A table cell must be child of fo:table-row, not fo:block at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.PdfExporter.generatePDF(PdfExporter.java:161) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.PdfExporter.doExportEntity(PdfExporter.java:137) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.exportPage(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:119) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.doExport(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:85) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.PdfExporter.doExport(PdfExporter.java:80)

fields.description: An apostrophe character followed by a closing parenthesis character results in a spurious wink emoticon, i.e. ";)", and the closing parenthesis being dropped. E.g. apostrophe (') results in the following HTML being rendered: apostrophe (' The displayed rendering looks like if the following text were entered: apostrophe (';) This looks the same when displayed in the browser (IE 6.0) but results in the following piece of HTML: apostrophe (' Note that the only difference is an additional semicolon here. And that's exactly what's missing in the first piece of HTML to mark the end of the entity reference. It seems like in the first case this semicolon is together with the closing parenthesis rendered as an emoticon. With the double quote (") or greater than (>) characters, which also get rendered as entity references, this problem doesn't occur.
fields.summary: apostrophe followed by closing parenthesis rendered as wink emoticon

fields.description:
The title kinda says it call. Im not sure how easy it would be to do the import, unless you were to take it all and put it into a single page (converting into confluence-style code) and allow the user to split it up if he/she wishes.

The export would be much simpler and far more benificial to people in companies like our where managers prefer to pass word documents around attached to emails, but techies / developers prefer to edit things centrally.

I envisage the export working the same way that an export to PDF does, just to a Word document.

Take the following blog: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/2004/03/09/Sample+Blog - it looks how I intended to and how I want it to be seen.

Now take the following link:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/2004/03/09/ - that doesnt! The text has gone grey and the heading style have changed.

Personally, I think that if you edit a page to look a certain way - it should look like that, no matter where you see it from.

fields.summary: Tables not getting formatted correctly within the lists!

fields.description:
Take the following page code:

----
# Item 1
# Item 2
# Item 3

_place a table for pllustration purposes here_

# Item 4
## Item 4.1
## Item 4.2
## Item 4.3
# Item 5
----

It would be nice if the numbering could be joined / continued in another numbered block. I have no idea of a suitable UI for this. Perhaps macros would be better in this case allowing for incremental named variables, for example:

----
{counter:myList++} Item 1
{counter:myList++} Item 2
{counter:myList++} Item 3

_place a table for pllustration purposes here_

{counter:myList++} Item 4
{counter:myList:subList++} Item 4.1
{counter:myList:subList++} Item 4.2
{counter:myList:subList++} Item 4.3
{counter:myList++} Item 5
----

{counter:myList:subList++} could be replaced with {counter:myList}{counter:subList++} if that makes life easier. Variable would default to 1 if nonexistant (using the above idea).

This could extend to allow numbering to be used in headers:

h1. {counter:myTitles++} The meaning of life
...
h1. {counter:myTitles++} Why fish need friends
fields.summary: Joined Numbered Bullet Points

fields.description:
Take the following page code:

* _Bullet A_
* _Bullet B_
*# _Bullet B_ *Number 1*
*# _Bullet B_ *Number 2*
*# _Bullet B_ *Number 3*
* _Bullet C_

When executed it gets very confused between what should be bulletted and what should be bolded. If you remove the bolding around "Number X" then it works fine.

Interestingly, if you replace "Number" with "#" [like follows] it works that out ok (and itterates the # litterally) but you still end up with the same kinda of mixed up output.

* _Bullet A_
* _Bullet B_
*# _Bullet B_ *# 1*
*# _Bullet B_ *# 2*
*# _Bullet B_ *# 3*
* _Bullet C_
fields.summary: Bold not working inside a sub-numbered Bullet

line 3

eg. like this.

# Test line 1
# Test line 2
# Test \

fields.description:
It would be perfect if it were possible to include () in a page title, when it comes do documenting methods/functions.

For example, I have a class with a method called .fooBar(), it would be great for the page title to be ".fooBar()"

When the brackets are at the end of the page tile, I am unable to save or even preview the page - clicking either button takes me back to the edit view.

Should the "()" be in the middle of the title, the following error is given:

---------------------------
 The title you have entered contains invalid characters (:, @, /, \, &, !, |, #, $, *, ;, ~, [, ], (, ), {, }, <, >).
---------------------------

I usually create new pages by placing links to them from an existing page, then clicking the link to automatically go to the "add page" screen.

For example, [.fooBar()]  <-- I click the resulting link and it goes to the "add page" screen, allows me to choose a template, enter herds of info in to the page and then, only when I come to preview or save, does it thorw a wobbler.

If () are never going to be allowed in a page title (as your error message above suggests) I would at least like to:

a) have a proper error message when trying to save or preview the page so I don't end up there wondering what is going on and eventually starting to question my own sanity (did I just click that button? pheraps I do have the memory retention of a goldfish?) ;)

b) not be allowed to create a new page from a link that has () in it thus alerting me to the fact that () are not valid page title characters 2 hours before finally doing a test with () in the middle of a title and seeing the error message :P

If you could allow () in a page title, even if only as the last 2 characters, it would be a huge dream IMHO ;)  Failing that, see CONF-885 for an alternate solution to the problem :D
fields.summary: Cannot create pages with () in title

fields.description:
Syntax Highlighting already exists for Java and XML, highlighting for Java Script (ECMA 232) would also be extreemly useful for us.

As most of our frontends are done in Flash, Action Script support would also be invaliuble to us if we were to use confluence as our documentation platform (which we do).

The only main difference between JS and AS is the list of predefined functions/classes/objects. The ability to have the JS predefined functions and then be able to add groups of predefined functions (eg: AS core functions, and then custom core api functions/classes/objects).
fields.summary: Syntax Highlighting for Java Script and Action Script

fields.description:
The text in the Environment section, outputs a structured XML document - however it lacks significant highlighting. For the sort of highlighting Im looking for, create a valid .xml file and open it up in Internet Explorer.

In addition, having the element nodes collapsable (like in IE) would be great for larger tree's - although Im not sure how easy that would be to actually implement.
fields.summary: Syntax Highlighting for XML {code} macro

fields.description:
Unzipped in webapps dir as per instructions, set up a conflunceHome directory, pointed to the home directory in the init file.

Initial setup page shows up fine

Each subsequent page of setup displays with just the left hand "setup steps" on left but no content in main part of page. Checking source shows no data in the main area.

By hitting the root page again, am automatically redirected to the setup and the main content for the next step is properly displayed.

After running through setup by reloading from the home page on each step, confluence reports it is setup. Hitting home page shows home page. However, no styles seem to be applied. Hitting the style sheet URL returns a blank page instead of style sheet content. Going to the admin UI pages results in the same "links on left" showing up fine, but main content of the page not being included.

I do see several errors like the followin in the velocity.log file:

2004-03-02 17:25:01,272 - RHS of #set statement is null. Context will not be modified. /template/xhtml/spacelist.vm [line 2, column 1]

Any help on debugging this problem would be greatly appreciated.

-iain
fields.summary: Setup problem (page rendering problem?)

fields.description:
I'm sure someone will have already raised this but could not find any existing issue with it mentioned.

It would be a dream if it were possible to upload a load of icons to the server and then have the ability to choose which icon to represent a page with.  Also, to be able to set a default icon for templates (so pages made with that template would get the icon but you could still override it on the page).

It would be even better that if you had a link to a page which used the page title as the displayed text on the link, if the icon would appear next to it.

eg. If page title was "fish" then...

[fish]  would show icon + fish, both hyperlinked to page

[kipper|fish] would just show kipper hyperlinked to page, no icon

Obviously, if no icon specified then no icon in the link regardless.

The ability to set an icon for a page would enable a visual cue to be given as to what sort of page it is.  For example, I might create a page with a load of links on it so I'd want a link icon, or a page with a load of files in it with a disk icon, etc.
fields.summary: Assign icons to pages

fields.description: Currently they are sent for inline links, but not for shortcut links.
fields.summary: Trackbacks are not sent for shortcut links

fields.description:
It would be great if the heirarchy view in a space could be a proper treeview with collapse/expand, etc.

(sorry if this is a duplicate but I was unable to find any other reference to this).
fields.summary: Hierarchy view as proper treeview

fields.description:
Having unique page titles within a space is a great idea as it avoids confusion and makes it really easy to link to a page.  However...

If you could have an optional "display" or "alternate" title, you would be able to take advatage of other aspects of the system more readily.

The main example I am thinking of is using Confluence for software documentation and taking advantage of it's hierarchy view for class structures, etc.

The ability to show an alternate title in the hierarchy view would make it far more friendly to end-users IMHO.  If no display/alternate title is given, default to page title on displays.

When viewing the page itself, or linking to a page, then the normal page title would be displayed.
fields.summary: Display/Alternative Title property for pages, etc

Other MySQL clients works without any problems.

I uses 'autoReconnect=true' option in database connection.

When Confluence stops to work (shows only exceptions), I still see connection to the MySQL database. Only 1 connection, not two as usual when Confluence works.
